sn35.113:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Nādika in the brick house.
sn35.113:4.2: Then while the Buddha was in private retreat he spoke this explanation of the teaching:
sn35.113:4.3: “Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.
sn35.113:4.4: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.113:4.5: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.113:4.6: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.113:4.7: Craving is a condition for grasping.
sn35.113:4.8: Grasping is a condition for future existence.
sn35.113:4.9: Future existence is a condition for rebirth.
sn35.113:4.10: Rebirth is a condition that gives rise to old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn35.113:4.11: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn35.113:4.13: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and phenomena.
sn35.113:4.14: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.113:4.15: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.113:4.16: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.113:4.17: Craving is a condition for grasping.
sn35.113:4.18: Grasping is a condition for future existence.
sn35.113:4.19: Future existence is a condition for rebirth.
sn35.113:4.20: Rebirth is a condition that gives rise to old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn35.113:4.21: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn35.113:5.1: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.
sn35.113:5.2: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.113:5.3: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.113:5.4: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.113:5.5: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn35.113:5.6: When grasping ceases, future existence ceases.
sn35.113:5.7: When future existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
sn35.113:5.8: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn35.113:5.9: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases. …
sn35.113:5.11: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and phenomena.
sn35.113:5.12: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.113:5.13: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.113:5.14: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.113:5.15: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn35.113:5.17: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
sn35.113:6.1: Now at that time a certain monk was standing listening in on the Buddha.
sn35.113:6.4: “Monk, did you hear that explanation of the teaching?”
sn35.113:6.6: “You should learn that explanation of the teaching,
sn35.113:6.9: That explanation of the teaching is beneficial and relates to the fundamentals of the spiritual life.”
